newsitem.title: EGYPT: Suez Steel offer oversubscribed early.
newsitem.headline: Suez Steel offer oversubscribed early.

text.p: A public offering of 30 percent of the equity in new Egyptian firm Suez Steel is already oversubscribed, the agents of the sale said on Thursday.

The agents, National Bank of Egypt, said investors can however continue to put in bids for the shares until February 23, earlier than the previous deadline. The 360,000 shares are on sale at a fixed price of 100 pounds.
In January, the founders of the steel company -- two state-owned banks, six firms and one individual -- said the offer would be open for 15 days from February 11.
Investors must apply for at least five shares and need pay only a quarter of their nominal value now, the founders said.
They said the firm will ask for the rest within five years from the date of establishment.
The founders already own 840,000 shares of the 1.2 million issued shares of the firm.
The firm, to be set up in the Red Sea province of Suez, will produce steel billets, they added. It has forecast a return on capital of not less than 20 percent a year.
